summary: The "See the Board Act" proposes a grant program administered by the Secretary of Health and Human Services to support free eye care services for students in public elementary and secondary schools. The grants will be awarded to nonprofit organizations to purchase equipment, cover operational costs, and offer vision screenings, exams, and eyeglasses through mobile clinics. The bill emphasizes the importance of following medical recommendations for eye care and authorizes appropriations for the program from fiscal years 2026-2031.
